meanings.definition: A person who advocates or practices privatization.
meanings.sent1: The privatists believed in transferring ownership to individuals.
meanings.sent2: The privatists argued for selling state-owned companies to private individuals.
meanings.sent3: The privatists joked that everything should be privately owned, even the air we breathe.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, the privatists were the champions of free enterprise.
meanings.sent5: The privatists' mission was to promote the idea of private ownership in all sectors.

meanings.definition: Belonging to or characteristic of privatists.
meanings.sent1: Her privatists views influenced her political decisions.
meanings.sent2: The privatists policies aimed to reduce government control.
meanings.sent3: The privatists-themed party was a hit among like-minded individuals.
meanings.sent4: His privatists mindset led him to support deregulation.
meanings.sent5: The privatists approach emphasized individual ownership and responsibility.

meanings.sent1: The conference focused on privatists' impact on the economy.
meanings.sent2: The privatists movement gained momentum in the political arena.
meanings.sent3: The privatists event brought together supporters of privatization.
meanings.sent4: Her speech highlighted the benefits of privatists policies.
meanings.sent5: The privatists discussion shed light on the role of private ownership in society.
